name: Sweet Lassi
history: Sweet Lassi is a popular traditional yogurt-based drink from the Indian subcontinent. It's a classic beverage known for its creamy, frothy texture, often enjoyed as a cooling refreshment or to balance the heat of spicy Indian meals.
description: Sweet Lassi is a smooth, creamy drink made with yogurt, water or milk, and sugar. It's often flavored with cardamom or rosewater and is revered for its digestive properties and soothing, refreshing taste.

instructions.title: Blend Ingredients
instructions.description: In a blender, combine the yogurt, sugar, water or milk, cardamom powder, and rose water if using. Blend until smooth and frothy.

instructions.title: Adjust Consistency
instructions.description: Add ice cubes to the blender and blend again. Adjust the consistency by adding more water or milk, if desired.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Pour the lassi into glasses and serve chilled. Optionally, garnish with a sprinkle of cardamom powder or chopped nuts.

tips: Adjust the amount of sugar to your taste. You can also use honey as a sweetener.
Use chilled yogurt and water/milk for an instantly cold lassi.
variations: Experiment with different flavors by adding mango, banana, or other fruits.
For a vegan version, use plant-based yogurt and milk.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a day.
storage.instructions: Store in a covered container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in tall glasses with a straw.
Garnish with a light sprinkle of ground pistachios or almonds for an elegant touch.
